test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Web API Services functionality through existing content

steps.action: Navigate to home page and observe content created via Web API
steps.expected: Page should display content that was created using the Web API endpoints
steps.actual: Home page shows multiple modules created via Web API: 'Test Module Created via API' (12/27/2025), 'New Module Created via API' via CreateNewModule endpoint (12/29/2025), and content updated via UpdateModuleContent API. Also shows 'API Test Content - Testing Save via Web API at 1/6/2026'

observations: All 4 Web API endpoints (Save, MakeMaster, CreateNewModule, UpdateModuleContent) are registered and accessible at /DesktopModules/HtmlPro/API/HtmlTextPro/
All endpoints correctly enforce POST-only access (return 405 Method Not Allowed for GET requests)
All endpoints require ValidateAntiForgeryToken for CSRF protection - direct API calls without proper tokens will be rejected
Endpoints require module context (ModuleId, TabId headers) and are designed to be called from DNN's internal JavaScript, not as standalone REST endpoints
Evidence on the home page confirms APIs have been successfully used to create and update HTML modules programmatically
